Header: A Former accountant of Water Resources Board imprisoned
Content: A former accountant of the National Water Resources and Drainage Board, who was found guilty of cheating over 12 million rupees, was sentenced to 37 years rigorous imprisonment today. In addition to the jail term, High Court Judge Gihan Kulatunga imposed a fine of 4 million rupees on the convict and also ordered him to pay compensation of 13 million rupees to the Water Board. Ananda Mabole, who served in the capacity of an accountant at the Kelaniya branch of the Water Board, was found guilty of using the forged signature of the branch manager to cheat 57 cheques of the institution that amounted to 12 million rupees.
